DataElement.preferredName: Image Guided Radiation Therapy  Precision Margin Reduced Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the administration of a procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy, providing greater accuracy and causing less damage to healthy tissue during patient positioning and margin reduction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Image Guided Radiation Therapy  Precision Margin Reduced Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of a procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy, providing greater accuracy and causing less damage to healthy tissue during patient positioning and margin reduction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy. The pictures are made using CT, ultrasound, X-ray, or other imaging techniques. Image-guided radiation therapy makes radiation therapy more accurate and causes less damage to healthy tissue.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses a computer to create a picture of a tumor to help guide the radiation beam during radiation therapy. The pictures are made using CT, ultrasound, X-ray, or other imaging techniques. Image-guided radiation therapy makes radiation therapy more accurate and causes less damage to healthy tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative representation of the degree of accuracy necessary for or associated with a particular action.:Margin; the boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.:Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A quantitative representation of the degree of accuracy necessary for or associated with a particular action.
A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.
Made less in size or amount or degree.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
